title: A guide to the dustR package
text: vignette present dustR, alternative data analysis workflow GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas (WTA) spatial transcriptomics data. R pacakge provides series functions assist quality assurance minimising segment loss maximising gene detection rates.

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: development version dustR can installed GitHub:
code: if (!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("jelmar-quist/dustR")

title: A guide to the dustR package
code: library(dustR) library(GeomxTools) library(scales) library(robustbase) library(mclust) library(reshape)

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: recommend loading data similiar …
code: load("/Users/k1217281/Documents/GeoMX/EllieAlberts/materials/v2/eset.RData")

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: Template Control (NTC) used assess contamination segments 96-well plate. general rule, NTCs 1,000 less 10,000 sequencing reads may indicate contamination. count: values >1,000 indicate contamination segments associated NTC; however, cases NTC count 1,000- 10,000, segments may used NTC data uniformly low (e.g. 0-2 counts probes). checkNTC identifies NTCs NanoStringGeoMxSet object reports () number NTCs containing 1,000 sequencing reads, (ii) number segments risk contamination. plotNTC can used plot number sequencing reads NTC.  Due risk contamination NTCs 10,000 sequencing reads, recommend discard segments originating 96 well plate. NTCs 1,000, less 10,000 sequencing reads, gene count distribution uniform (.e. genes present similar level within NTC), segments 96 well plate can used analysis. checkNTCcounts assess plot gene counts distribution NTC.  Based findings , segments likely contaminated removed, along NTCs. vignette, remove NTCs .
code: checkNTC(eSet) ## Identified 8 out of 8 NTCs with >= 1000 sequencing reads. ## 525 out of 525 segments may be at risk, please run checkNTCcounts() before proceeding. plotNTC(eSet) checkNTCcounts(eSet) eSet <- eSet[,grep("A01", colnames(eSet), invert = TRUE)]

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas (WTA) panel includes 139 negative control probes designed estimate background segment directly affect gene detection rate subsequent downstream analysis. Note negative control probes designed target sequences External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC), present human genome. plotNegativeProbes, slope overall abundance negative control probe number sequencing reads estimated.  Assuming negative control probes present equal abundance, slope less similar 139 negative control probes. density plot plotNegativeProbes suggests majority negative control probes indeed case. However, 5 negative control probes, slope considerably steep, resulting increased background reduced gene detection rates. suggest remove negative control probes using filterNegativeProbes.
code: plotNegativeProbes(eSet) eSet <- filterNegativeProbes(eSet) ## Removed 5 out of 139 negative control probes due to poor performance.

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: Following inspection NTCs cleaning negative control probes, processing data can continue. processing data, inspect four segment characteristics identify poor performing segments, describes .
code: source("/Users/k1217281/Documents/resources/GeoMx/calculateNegativeProbe.R") eSet <- shiftCountsOne(eSet) eSet <- calculateNegativeProbe(eSet)

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: relationship number nuclei segment area provide insight performance segmentation nuclei count given segment. positive relation nuclei area expected. Using checkNuclei, segments relationship deviates regression model flagged. can visualise inspect findings using plotNuclei.  Segments deviate model highlighted black outline. data presented vignette, segments performed expected.
code: eSet <- checkNuclei(eSet) ## 0 out of 517 segments were flagged due to abnormal behavior. plotNuclei(eSet)

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: per recommendqations, sequencing libraries prepared ~100 sequencing reads per µm2 segment. modelling relationship area number sequencing reads, segments less sequencing reads expected based area can identified. result tissue quality incorrect pooling sequencing libraries. checkRawSequencing suggests 12 segments considerably less sequencing reads expected based area. can visualise inspect detail using plotRawSequencing.  plot suggests majority segments number sequencing reads expected, , number sequencing reads less expected, indiated black outline. suggest discard segments.
code: eSet <- checkRawSequencing(eSet) ## 12 out of 517 segments had less sequencing reads than expected and were flagged. plotRawSequencing(eSet)

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: sequencing saturation provides information quality sequencing enoughn sequenced capture full diversity segment. checkSaturation calculates sequencing saturation flags segments saturation 50% (default). 73 segments flagged reduced sequencing saturation. can visualise inspect saturation using plotSaturation.  median saturation 80%, samples sequencing saturation 50%. analysis time, suggest segments discarded. However, practice, opt resequence segments improve saturation.
code: eSet <- checkSaturation(eSet) ## Removed 73 out of 517 segments due to low sequencing saturation. plotSaturation(eSet)

what: Geometric mean of negative control probes
title: A guide to the dustR package
text: calculate background noise segments, geometric mean negative control probes used. can assess geometric mean across segments using plotGeoMeanNegProbes.  barplot highlight large range geometric mean across segments. Overall, low geometric mean considered good, however, segments geometric mean low (default 1) tend poor gene detection rate. segments can flagged using checkGeoMeanNegProbes. function flag segments low geometric mean, also calculates average gene detection rate segments compares remaining segments. Given gene detection rate segments geometric mean negative control probes less 1%, suggest discarded.
code: plotGeoMeanNegProbes(eSet) eSet <- checkGeoMeanNegProbes(eSet) ## The average gene detection rate in segments with a NegGeoMean <= 1 is 0.16% ## The average gene detection rate in segments with a NegGeoMean > 1 is 18.22% ## 17 out of 517were flagged due to a low geometric mean of the negative control probes.

title: A guide to the dustR package
code: plotFilterSegments(eSet) eSet <- filterSegments(eSet) ## Removed77 out of 517segments that were flagged.

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: createPseudobulk exactly name implies, creates pseudobulk data aggregating gene counts segments given sample. function also updates Segment, Nulcei Area columns, well reported number sequencing reads. Sample definitions obtained id.vars, specificy appropiate column pData. second flavour function implemented generate pseudobulk ROI. .e. given ROI PanCK CD45 segment, segments collated together. Note function still requires user specify appropiate id.vars prevent segments different samples aggregated. creating pseudobulk data recommended perform quality control.
code: load("/Users/k1217281/Documents/GeoMX/EllieAlberts/materials/v2/eset.RData") eSet_pseudobulk <- createPseudobulk(eSet, id.vars = "Slide Name") ncol(eSet) ## Samples  ##     525 ncol(eSet_pseudobulk) ## Samples  ##       9 load("/Users/k1217281/Documents/GeoMX/EllieAlberts/materials/v2/eset.RData") eSet_pseudobulk <- createPseudobulk(eSet, id.vars = "Slide Name", bySlide = FALSE) ncol(eSet) ## Samples  ##     525 ncol(eSet_pseudobulk) ## Samples  ##     256

title: A guide to the dustR package
text: spatialGE R package design analysing visualising spatial transcriptomics data.
code: require(spatialGE) ## Loading required package: spatialGE load("/Users/k1217281/Documents/GeoMX/LEAP_SA_v3/materials/SA_ReadInOnly.RData") eSet <- eSet[,!is.na(eSet$Segment)] eSet <- eSet[,eSet$Segment == "PanCK+"]  eSet_STlist <- createSTlist(eSet, id.vars = "LEAP_ID") ## Found list of dataframes. ## Matching gene expression and coordinate data... ## Converting counts to sparse matrices ## Completed STlist! ##

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jelmar Quist. Author, maintainer. Isobelle Wall. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Quist J (2024). dustR: Tidying GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas spatial transcriptomics data R. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dustR: Tidying GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas spatial transcriptomics data in R},   author = {Jelmar Quist},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Tidying GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas spatial transcriptomics data in R
text: dustR package provides series functions assist quality assurance GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas (WTA) spatial transcriptomics data minimising segment loss maximising gene detection rates.

title: Tidying GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas spatial transcriptomics data in R
text: Install development version GitHub
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("jelmar-quist/dustR")

title: Assessment of NegGeoMean — checkGeoMeanNegProbes
text: geometric mean negative control probes (NegGeoMean) used distinguish signal noise determines quantifiable limit gene expression. Segments low NegGeoMean often exhibit low gene detection rates.

title: Assessment of NegGeoMean — checkGeoMeanNegProbes
code: checkGeoMeanNegProbes(eSet, minNegGeoMean = 1)

title: Assessment of NegGeoMean — checkGeoMeanNegProbes
text: eSet NanoStringGeoMxSet object. minNegGeoMean Threshold define minimum required NegGeoMean. Default 1.

title: Assessment of NegGeoMean — checkGeoMeanNegProbes
text: readNanoStringGeoMxSet object.

title: Assessment of NegGeoMean — checkGeoMeanNegProbes
code: checkGeoMeanNegProbes(eSet) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'eSet' not found

title: No Template Control assessment — checkNTC
text: Template Control (NTC) included sequencing plate (well A01) detect contamination sequencing library. NTCs 1,000 sequencing reads indicate contamination examined .

title: No Template Control assessment — checkNTC
code: checkNTC(eSet)

title: No Template Control assessment — checkNTC
text: eSet NanoStringGeoMxSet object.

title: No Template Control assessment — checkNTC
text: Nothing.

what: No Template Control count uniformity — checkNTCcounts
title: No Template Control count uniformity — checkNTCcounts
text: Template Controls (NTCs) 1,000 sequencing reads, counts expected uniformly distributed (.e. detected similar abundances). assessed comparing gene count distribution NTC uniform distribution comparable parameters using Kolmogorov–Smirnov test.

code: checkNTCcounts(eSet)

what: Assessment of the relationship between Nuclei and Area — checkNuclei
title: Assessment of the relationship between Nuclei and Area — checkNuclei
text: Assesses relationship number nuclei area size across experiment. Segments deviate relationship flagged.

title: Assessment of the relationship between Nuclei and Area — checkNuclei
code: checkNuclei(eSet = eSet, removeZero = TRUE, Nuclei = "Nuclei", Area = "Area")

title: Assessment of the relationship between Nuclei and Area — checkNuclei
text: eSet NanoStringGeoMxSet acquired via readNanoStringGeoMxSet(). removeZero TRUE, discard segments either number nuclei area size 0. Nuclei column containing nuclei counts. Area column containing area size.
